00009 #ifndef __CVM_PCI_PKO_H__
00010 #define __CVM_PCI_PKO_H__
00011 
00012 #include "cvm-driver-defs.h"
00013 #include "cvm-oct-dev.h"
00014 
00015 #define   PKO_DIRECT_DATA   0x00
00016 #define   PKO_GATHER_DATA   0x01
00017 #define   PKO_LINKED_DATA   0x02
00018 
00019 #define   CVM_USE_HW_CKSUM_OFFLOAD    1
00020 
00021 #define CVM_PCI_PKO_FPA_POOL     CVMX_FPA_PACKET_POOL
00022 #define CVM_PCI_PKO_SCRATCHPAD   CVM_DRV_SCR_PACKET_BUF_PTR
00023 
00024 #define CVM_PCI_PKO_ALLOC_BUFFER(ptr)    \
00025       ptr = cvm_drv_fpa_alloc_async(CVM_PCI_PKO_SCRATCHPAD, CVM_PCI_PKO_FPA_POOL)
00026 
00027 #define CVM_PCI_PKO_FREE_BUFFER(ptr)     \
00028         cvm_drv_fpa_free(ptr, CVM_PCI_PKO_FPA_POOL, 0)
00029 
00030 #define CVM_PCI_PKO_SET_FPA_POOL(lptr)   \
00031         lptr.s.pool = CVM_PCI_PKO_FPA_POOL

00036 /** Core: Sets up the map of PKO hardware port & queues corresponding to the
00037     PCI output queues.
00038     @return Success: 0; Failure: 1.
00039 */
00040 int   setup_pci_pko_ports(void);

00045 
00046 /** Core: Call this routine to send a data packet to the Octeon output
00047   *  queues. For a linked mode or direct mode data, this routine
00048   *  adds another buffer to the start of the linked list into which the
00049   *  response header is copied. For a gather mode data sent by user,
00050   *  this routine creates a new gather list and makes the user
00051   *  response header the first element of the gather list. Needless
00052   *  to say, if performance is important, you should make space
00053   *  to add 8 bytes of response header before your data and call
00054   *  cvm_pko_post_command() directly.
00055   *
00056   *  @param user_resp_hdr  - the response header that identifies the
00057   *                          user data.
00058   *  @param dptr           - pointer to the user data.
00059   *  @param ptr_type       - type of data pointed by dptr( linked/gather/direct)
00060   *  @param total_bytes    - amount of user data (excludes response header)
00061   *  @param segs  - number of user buffers (in linked and gather mode)
00062   *  @param port  - PKO port on which to send data ( 32 <= port <= 35)
00063   *
00064   *  @return  Success: returns 0, else 1.
00065   */
00066 int
00067 cvm_pko_send_data(cvmx_resp_hdr_t  *user_resp_hdr,
00068                   cvmx_buf_ptr_t    dptr,
00069                   cvm_ptr_type_t    ptr_type,
00070                   uint32_t          total_bytes,
00071                   uint32_t          segs,
00072                   uint32_t          port);
00073 
00074 
00075 
00076 
00077 
00078 /** Core: The arguments have the same meaning as the cvm_pko_send_data() API
00079  * above. This API assumes that 8 bytes of response header is available at the
00080  * start of the first buffer pointed by lptr.
00081  *
00082  * @param lptr     - Pointer to data or gather buffer in Octeon's local memory.
00083  * @param ptr_type - Describes the type of buffer available at dptr.
00084  * @param segs     - Number of buffers.
00085  * @param total_bytes - Sum of data bytes from all buffers.
00086  * @param port  - PKO port on which to send data ( 32 <= port <= 35)
00087  *
00088  * @return Success: 0; Failure: 1.
00089  */
00090 int
00091 cvm_pko_send_direct(cvmx_buf_ptr_t   lptr, 
00092                     cvm_ptr_type_t   ptr_type,
00093                     uint32_t         segs,
00094                     uint32_t         total_bytes,
00095                     uint32_t         port);
00096 
00097 
00098 
00099 
00100 
00101 
00102 
00103 /** Core: The first 5 parameters have the same meaning as cvm_pko_send_data()
00104  * API above. This API also assumes that 8 bytes of response header is
00105  * available at the start of the first buffer.  
00106  * In addition, the flags parameter is used to pass additional flags.
00107  * The flags_data parameter provides additional information when flags is
00108  * non-zero. Currently flags is reserved for use by the driver and should
00109  * always be set to zero.
00110  *
00111  * @param lptr     - Pointer to data or gather buffer in Octeon's local memory.
00112  * @param ptr_type - Describes the type of buffer available at dptr.
00113  * @param segs     - Number of buffers.
00114  * @param total_bytes - Sum of data bytes from all buffers.
00115  * @param port     - PKO port on which to send data ( 32 <= port <= 35)
00116  * @param flags    - additional flags.
00117  * @param flag_data - data associated with the flags.
00118  *
00119  *
00120  * @return Success: 0; Failure: 1.
00121  */
00122 
00123 int
00124 cvm_pko_send_direct_flags(cvmx_buf_ptr_t   lptr, 
00125                           cvm_ptr_type_t   ptr_type,
00126                           uint32_t         segs,
00127                           uint32_t         total_bytes,
00128                           uint32_t         port,
00129                           uint32_t         flags,
00130                           uint64_t         flag_data);
00131 
00132 
00133 
00134 
00135 
00136 
00137 /** Core: The arguments have the same meaning as the cvm_pko_send_direct()
00138  * API above. This API assumes that 8 bytes of response header is available
00139  * at the start of the first buffer pointed by lptr.
00140  * The oq_no corresponds to the PCI output queue ring number (not the PCI port)
00141  * and ranges from 0 to 31. This API can be used when you have more than 1
00142  * output queue ring per PCI port to target the output queue directly. The
00143  * previous API.s always sent to the first queue in the PCI port. Additional
00144  * setup is required before using this API.
00145  *
00146  * @param lptr     - Pointer to data or gather buffer in Octeon's local memory.
00147  * @param ptr_type - Describes the type of buffer available at dptr.
00148  * @param segs     - Number of buffers.
00149  * @param total_bytes - Sum of data bytes from all buffers.
00150  * @param oq_no    - The PCI output queue to send this data.
00151  *
00152  * @return Success: 0; Failure: 1.
00153  */
00154 
00155 
00156 
00157 
00158 
00159 int
00160 cvm_send_pci_pko_direct(cvmx_buf_ptr_t   lptr,
00161                         cvm_ptr_type_t   ptr_type,
00162                         uint32_t         segs,
00163                         uint32_t         total_bytes,
00164                         uint32_t         oq_no);

00170 int
